summary: the scarlet Plague and the Fear of Pandemic Jack London (1876–1916) was a writer and journalist and author of classic novels including The Call of the Wild (1903) and White Fang (1906). he was also an active member of the Socialist Party of America, and his works often contained explicit critiques against capitalism and war. many stories would today be classified as science fiction, and some had pandemics and infectious diseases as subjects.
